description: Manage packet capture sessions on VMs.

commands.name: az network watcher packet-capture create
commands.summary: Create and start a packet capture session.
commands.syntax:
az network watcher packet-capture create --name
                                         --resource-group
                                         [--capture-limit]
                                         [--capture-size]
                                         [--exclude]
                                         [--file-path]
                                         [--filters]
                                         [--include]
                                         [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                         [--storage-account]
                                         [--storage-path]
                                         [--target]
                                         [--target-type {AzureVM, AzureVMSS}]
                                         [--time-limit]
                                         [--vm]
examples: az network watcher packet-capture create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyPacketCaptureName --vm MyVm --storage-account MyStorageAccount

az network watcher packet-capture create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyPacketCaptureName --vm MyVm --storage-account MyStorageAccount --filters '[{"protocol":"TCP", "remoteIPAddress":"1.1.1.1-255.255.255", "localIPAddress":"10.0.0.3", "remotePort":"20"}, {"protocol":"TCP", "remoteIPAddress":"1.1.1.1-255.255.255", "localIPAddress":"10.0.0.3", "remotePort":"80"}, {"protocol":"TCP", "remoteIPAddress":"1.1.1.1-255.255.255", "localIPAddress":"10.0.0.3", "remotePort":"443"}, {"protocol":"UDP"}]'
az network watcher packet-capture create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyPacketCaptureName --vm MyVmVMSS --storage-account MyStorageAccount --target-type "AzureVMSS"
az network watcher packet-capture create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyPacketCaptureName --target MyVmVMSS --storage-account MyStorageAccount --target-type "AzureVMSS" --include "0" "1"
az network watcher packet-capture create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyPacketCaptureName --vm MyVmVMSS --storage-account MyStorageAccount --target-type "AzureVMSS" --exclude "0" "1"

commands.name: az network watcher packet-capture delete
commands.syntax:
az network watcher packet-capture delete --location
                                         --name
                                         [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network watcher packet-capture delete -n packetCaptureName -l westcentralus

commands.name: az network watcher packet-capture list
commands.summary: List all packet capture sessions within a region.
examples: az az network watcher packet-capture list -l westus

commands.name: az network watcher packet-capture show
commands.summary: Show details of a packet capture session.
examples: az network watcher packet-capture show -l westus -n MyPacketCapture

commands.name: az network watcher packet-capture show-status
commands.summary: Show the status of a packet capture session.
commands.syntax:
az network watcher packet-capture show-status --location
                                              --name
                                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network watcher packet-capture show-status -l westus -n MyPacketCapture

commands.name: az network watcher packet-capture stop
commands.summary: Stop a running packet capture session.
commands.syntax:
az network watcher packet-capture stop --location
                                       --name
                                       [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network watcher packet-capture stop -l westus -n MyPacketCapture

commands.name: az network watcher packet-capture wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
